Title: COUNT_OUT Over-Count Bug
Description: COUNT_OUT counter incremented on out_valid instead of out_fire causing multiple counts per packet during backpressure
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Enable backpressure (out_ready=0)
2. Assert out_valid
3. Hold for N cycles
4. Read COUNT_OUT
Expected Behavior: COUNT_OUT should increment once per packet (on out_fire)
Actual Behavior: COUNT_OUT incremented every cycle out_valid was high
Root Cause: Wrong trigger condition: if(out_valid) instead of if(out_fire)
Resolution: Fixed in RTL v1.1 - line 287-289 now uses if(out_fire)
Notes: Confirmed fixed - counter invariant now passes

Title: Output Stability Violation During Stall
Description: Output signals changed while out_valid=1 and out_ready=0 (violates spec Section 6.3)
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Enable backpressure (out_ready=0)
2. out_valid asserted
3. Observe out_id/out_opcode/out_payload
Expected Behavior: Outputs must remain stable while stalled
Root Cause: s0 slot was being modified during stall
Resolution: Fixed in RTL v1.1 - s0 slot only updates on out_fire

Title: ROT_AMT Not Configurable
Description: ROT_AMT hardcoded as localparam instead of register field
Expected Behavior: ROT_AMT should be configurable via register
Root Cause: Intentional design - spec v1.1 clarifies ROT_AMT is fixed at 4 bits
Resolution: Spec v1.1 confirms this is intentional design

Title: Virtual Interface Config DB Collision
Description: Multiple virtual interface types in uvm_config_db caused QuestaSim crash
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set stream_vif and reg_vif with same field name 'vif'
2. Run simulation
Root Cause: QuestaSim bug with parameterized virtual interfaces in config_db
Resolution: Direct uvm_config_db::set for each interface type

Title: Reset Wait Race Condition
Description: Bare wait for reset deassertion caused race conditions
Root Cause: Unclocked wait could complete before clock edge

Title: Zero-Time Loop in Monitor
Description: Forever loop without clock gate caused simulation hang
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Call monitor_input_packet() without clock edge
2. Run simulation
Root Cause: No clock edge in path through forever loop

Title: Reference Model Config Stale
Description: Reference model used stale internal config instead of RAL mirrored values
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Change MODE via RAL
2. Send packet
3. Check scoreboard
Resolution: Read config from m_reg_model in predict_output()
Notes: Reference model now reads from RAL

Title: Scoreboard FIFO Ordering Assumption
Description: Scoreboard assumed FIFO ordering but modes have different latencies
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Send packets in different modes
2. Check scoreboard matching
Root Cause: PASS=0, XOR=1, ADD=2, ROT=1 cycle latencies cause reordering
Resolution: Match by ID+OPCODE instead of FIFO order
Notes: Packets can arrive out of order
